Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Titofromau
Reviews.Content: Although I paid cash for everything upfront and paid for the telephone call I made off the motel phone as I checked out and asked if there was any outstanding fees but I owed nothing. This motel still charged my credit card ... This is theft . Never again make sure they don't make false charges to your card. I will be reporting this to my financial institution.

Reviews.Title: “a place to sleep, not much else”
Reviews.Author: JohnColumbus_Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight because we had an early connection in the morning out of LAX. The rate was very cheap, and there is not much else to expect here. The rooms are small and noisy. The continental breakfast in the morning is poorly stocked and cheap. There is a free shuttle to and from LAX however, which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, perfect for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: lilio74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night prior to my mother and son's 2 am departure out of LAX. The hotel is siutated perfectly a block away from LAX, and right next door to a Denny's and a gas station. The room was very clean, and everything well stocked and equipped, including extra pillows and blankets in the closet. The beds were comfortable, though I did find the pillows to be a bit on the hard side. The bathroom was spacious, although it was only stocked with shampoo and soap. No lotion, no conditioner. The staff at check-in was extremely polite and helpful with our request for a downstairs room. Fellow travelers: this is a comfortable property for ONE night, maybe two. Do NOT expect luxury, only functionality. They have an airport shuttle that runs every half hour to LAX around the clock, and parking is free. They also have free wi-fi and in-room coffee makers. Now, the rooms do have wallpaper like you stepped into the 80's, but if you're looking for a clean, safe place to stay right before or right after a long day of travel without breaking the bank, I would definitely recommend this place. They offer a free continental breakfast in the mornings, 6-9am, enough to hold you over until lunch. Again, everyone was very courteous in the dining room. The service all around was personable and exceeded my expectations. One warning, if you are a light sleeper, noise could be an issue. We had room 132 and could hear parking lot commotion throughout the night, as well as the arrival and departure of the airport shuttle, on top of expected airplane noise. We managed to sleep despite the noise, but maybe others should request a room farther from the main entrance/parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “LAX convenience - clean - good value”
Reviews.Author: AngloTom
Reviews.Content: Having arrived late evening LAX our group of four were tired after cross country flight. Collected by the small Travelodge shuttle bus which leaves the hotel every 30mins. Reception was welcoming and directed to our rooms which were quite a walk. Room was clean, bed comfortable, and a shower that worked - what more would you want at that price? Noise was not really an issue, tho' you could hear the occasional roar of jet engines in the distance - what do you expect when approx 0.5 to 0.75 miles from the airport? Tried to have breakfast, but all seats were taken, so just grabbed a bagel and coffee on the go. Breakfast room needs much more room for a hotel of this size. Reception arranged for the shuttle bus to take us to Hertz rental just a short distance away at no charge - excellent service. Driver was very friendly and helped with the bags. Only stayed the one night, but would stay there again under the same circumstances of somewhere very local to LAX at an inexpensive rate. One thing I did note, was the great care they went with their exotic tree, palms flowers etc. The garden was exceptionally well maintained and even included signs with the name of the bush, tree etc, which says a lot of the obvious caring management. Older hotel, but with good management.

Reviews.Title: “We love this stop”
Reviews.Author: canadiannorm
Reviews.Content: We have been coming here for years. For us it's a place to sleep and a place to kick back between adventure while visiting the LA area. We always book ahead and a few days before we call to confirm and ask for specific room usually the bottom along the pool with the gated parking lot behind the room. It's convenient, we always rent a car across the street and when it's time to go home, it's a quick and easy pack up drop the car and go. Probably the best breakfast at any of the travelodges we have stayed. Cold cereal, toast, bagels, English muffins, fruit, juice and all the condiments. It's a nice break from the big breakfasts at Denny's next door. It's about as central to everything as you could hope. Everyone we have dealt with there have been good to us, maybe a language barrier at times but nothing that would stop me from coming here again. The pool is always clean, there are people always sweeping the area or cleaning the rooms. As far as dampness that I have read in other reviews, you are by the ocean and in compound with a tropical forest in the center. I'm from Alberta so the humidity is welcome after a winter of dry cold air. I have heard it is louder in the back rooms but we didn't deal with anything we thought was room shaking or so loud we couldn't talk to each other. You won't find a better deal for what your getting anywhere in the area.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: bella2130
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in June 2011 for 1 night as we thought it was value for the money and close to airport, whilst the rooms smelt old and musty and were in poor condition it was ok for a night, booked again to stay this month for 2 nights before flying back home to AUS and was told the price over the phone, once we got there they had put the price up due to being at full capacity?!! Who does that! Then when we said we we're flying home early so would just take the half day stay rate of $39.95 plus tax, we were told it be $93 because they were full so don't offer that price clearly advertised in front of the desk! It's service and quality is 1 star we certainly went down the road to A much nicer hotel for $10 more! I won't recommend this hotel to anyone.. Shame on you travelodge LAX

Reviews.Title: “1950's Hollywood glam. Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Penny0988
Reviews.Content: Built in the 1950's to entice movie stars traveling from LAX before it was LAX, this hotel has multiple bungalow type buildings with wandering paths and little courtyards filled with foliage and flowers between the buildings. You can easily imagine stars laughing among the towering palms, bougainvillea, azaleas, camellias and ferns. Gardeners and romantics will be delighted! The pool is large, hotel is well kept and paths are freshly swept. Breakfast is standard continental but the bagels were fresh and the juice full strength. Have their own shuttle buses which run 24 hours (unlike some which advertise, but quit running at 11 pm). The review would have been 5 stars, but our room at the back of the property had quite a long wait for hot water in the 2 person tiled walk-in shower (probably the height of luxury in 1950).

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lottijune
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at a hotel close to the airport due to our flight being cancelled. We rang this hotel and got a great price, they picked us up from the airport. They we're helpful. It included continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be Called a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrChai2005
Reviews.Content: I arrived to LAX airport at 12am, I have booked this hotel on expedia it was on sale for $89 when I got therei find this is in noway a hotel its more of a motel but what really got me was the smell of the room was old and damp. service was good the breakfast was OK and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: Spendingitnow
Reviews.Content: Basic but perfectly adequate airport hotel, Stayed one night between flights. Main difficulty was finding the phones at LAX to call for the free shuttle but that needs to be addressed by the airport. Room comfortable with bath. Breakfast was cereals, juice, toast, fruit, cakes to suit most needs. We didn't experience the noise others have reported.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very good!”
Reviews.Author: JoVermont
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel with excellent service. Hotel itself would be a 3, it's old, but the staff bumps it up to a 4. When we needed to drop a rental car off at the airport the night before our flight, they offered to come get us at the rental agency if a shuttle back to the hotel was not offered by Alamo (it was). Everyone was so pleasant and accommodating throughout our brief stay. Shuttle service to airport had a followed, convenient schedule, minimal waiting. Room was basic, but was clean. Excellent value, not plush, but had everything we needed for a quick overnight stay. We'll stay there next time we need a hotel near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Useful location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Drapier
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, acceptable breakfast, really no problem at all with the on street parking, however, if you can, get an upstairs room - mine was downstairs and my neighbour above me was very loud - he would come in at midnight and start banging around - I heard nothing from either side but the sound insulation to the upstairs rooms was not good.

Reviews.Title: “Not for more than an airport layover”
Reviews.Author: Jkdemonte
Reviews.Content: The room was smoking when I requested non smoking. Loud - street, airplane, and hotel guest noise. There is an attached Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “Um bom hotel a 1 Km do Rental Car (A good hotel about 0.5 mille away)”

The service is kind and, as in all establishments in LA, most attendants are fluent in English and Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend very highly. Superb.”
Reviews.Author: OnParleFrancais
Reviews.Content: One of the best motel experiences I have ever had. Wonderful Southern California foliage around the pool, very well tended. Staff was busy but friendly (ask about the woman's photo on wall behind the desk; she was the one who designed the place). Campus layout is rambling and one CAN get lost, but that's fun, too! Denny's restaurant next door has a bar if you are so minded. Yes, I had a room at the back, so no traffic noise. Parking is outdoors but seems safe enough. The omnipresent panhandler in front can be ignored or paid off, depending which you prefer. And it is REASONABLY priced for such a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: deruo
Reviews.Content: This place must have been something in its' heyday. The pool area looks nice (at night anyway). We were rather perturbed that the shuttle didn't come for close to an hour, even after we called twice asking if it was coming. The second time, we were told that it had come but no one was there. Not true, as I myself waited while someone else ran in to call, and there was no shuttle. The shuttle isn't one of the fancy ones that drive by every 10 minutes, it was a battered old white van with a Travelodge plaque sitting on the dashboard. Finally, it showed up just in time for some people to board with us, that seemed to know the driver fairly well, as they had a detailed conversation in Spanish. A coincidence? We had a room that was on the highway side of the building. The traffic noise, even with all the windows closed prevented me from getting any sleep. It sounded as if the transport trucks outside were coming through the bathroom. The room itself was large but could really have used both a thorough cleaning, and then updating. I'd be more upset at the condition of the room if I was staying longer than 6 hours. A huge plus was the Dennys that was just outside the hotel, as well as free wi-fi. So many places advertise wi-fi these days, only for you to discover that you have to pay extortion-like fees to use it. Would I stay here again? Yes, for under 70.00 a night but I'd be sure to ask for a room away from the highway/thoroughfare that this place corners on.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say? Itâ€™s a Travelodge, close to LAX!”
Reviews.Author: davidp20v
Reviews.Content: Hopped off the plane for a quick overnighter before heading to Hawaii. We chose this hotel due to its location, below average price and â€˜freeâ€™ airport pickup. It served its purpose well, pretty gardens, friendly staff, the usual dated â€˜American styleâ€™ rooms (but clean) with free Wifi. Also nice having a Dennys on-site, amazed to see a healthier option on Dennyâ€™s menu!! Finally someone has an understanding that high fat/high calorie isnâ€™t ideal! Great for a cheaper one night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for lay-over”
Reviews.Author: Ade-n-Ju
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a day room and found it to be great for that purpose. Close to airport terminals with regular 'complimentary shuttle service'. Room had good wi-fi and comfortable bed and reasonable powered shower, which could have been a bit hotter. Room size was good as was the courtyard pool. TV with plenty of channels and lots of food options available for in room dining if needed. The hotel has a bit of character as well which we found nice. If we needed a day (or night) stay in LA would defiantly consider staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Better then super 8 close by and shuttle came fast”
Reviews.Author: Sabretoothed
Reviews.Content: Just use the free phone at arrival hall. Better then super 8 and similar price (stayed at super 8 on way up). Bed was nice. Staff were helpful and shuttle took 5-10 min to come friendly guy

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust the 'free' airport shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAussieJohn
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel due to the fact they offered day use rooms near LAX Airport at a reasonable cost. Was told to contact the hotel upon arrival, via the free hotel reservation phone service in the arrival hall, to arrange for the free shuttle pick-up. However, the hotel was NOT listed on the hotel reservation board in the United Airlines International Arrivals Area so had to make an expensive phone call via my overseas cell phone to arrange the shuttle pick-up. Was told to wait at the hotel shuttle pick-up stop immediately outside the terminal, which I did. Half an hour later there was no sign of the shuttle bus, so had to make another expensive phone call to be told that the shuttle would be there shortly. Another 30 minutes went by and still no shuttle, so yet another expensive phone call. The shuttle bus finally arrived and the driver told me he'd been around twice but couldn't find me or couldn't stop due to heavy traffic, which was totally untrue as I'd been standing there the whole time watching other hotel's shuttle buses come and go. However, after a 15 hour flight I wasn't in the mood to continue arguing, so went to the hotel expecting some kind of apology from the reception staff, to whom I'd been speaking on my phone calls. Not a word was said other than to indifferently hand me a key to a room and leave me to lug my own luggage to a room which couldn't have been further from the reception and up a flight of stairs (no elevator) despite the hotel being practically empty. The room itself was in a very dilapidated state with holes in the bed sheets and a stained blanket. I had a quick shower, changed my clothes and left. Why oh why did I fall for the 'cheap' day use rate, which, after I added the cost of three international calls to chase the shuttle, cost as much as a room in a decent hotel like the Hilton or Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Great for convenience and value”
Reviews.Author: GDPWestEngland
Reviews.Content: Overnight from p.m. 27th December, out on 7.30 a.m. shuttle back to LAX for next leg of journey. Room was booked by a friend locally, all details forwarded to me. Found shuttle phone at LAX and rang, and along came the shuttle. LAX lacks order and signs, and it wasn't easy (no fault of the Travelodge) to grasp where to stand outside to flag down the shuttlebus, but lo! It arrived and I was the only passenger to collect. Straight in, checked in fine, room clean and tidy at end of corridor after ramble through the leafy maze to get there and clear instructions. Went to bed at midnight, slept well for 10 hours and got up at 5 a.m. (so much for an eBay watch) with jetlag. Breakfast easy, simple and fine, and included in price. Checking out quick, all staff friendly and helpful. Shuttle back to the snitty mess that is LAX. Recommended for convenience, quiet and value. Free wifi that's fast, plus clean and quiet en suite room = ideal for overnight. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to crash for an evening”
Reviews.Author: 702_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently used this hotel while doing a mileage run out of LAX it worked out perfectly for me. Being that I would only use the room as a place to shower and sleep in between mileage runs, it satisfied my needs perfectly. They have a 24-hour shuttle to the airport, free parking (valid while your checked into a room) and complimentary continental breakfast which I did not get a chance to eat as I was generally out the door before 0600 to catch a flight. The rooms are quite old school, actually the whole hotel is. Ie. Think of your classic motel that Fred and Ethel would stay at. Granted, I like that sort of thing as it gives character to a place, unlike the large big box hotels that all start to look the same after awhile. While the room is far from fancy, the price was right and I would not have any qualms about coming back to crash here for an evening or two if I had to catch an early flight out of LAX or was doing another mileage run again. Thanks Travelodge LAX! You guys rock!

Reviews.Title: “"Tops for Travelers in Transit"”
Reviews.Author: GCSMaryland
Reviews.Content: Travelodge (LAX) is a great choice for location and price for ongoing flights from LAX to final destination. Stayed pre cruise for 1 1/2 days and post cruise for 1 day. Late check-out was perfect for our 11:30 p.m. flight to New Zealand to pick up ship. A small additional charge applied was well worth it. Requested and got room on ground level of 2 level hotel near lovely pool in well landscaped gardens and relaxing atmosphere. Room was large, clean with fresh towels and little amenities. Lobby was welcoming with fireplace and sitting area. Front desk staff was friendly and had room ready upon check-in. A plus was a "Denny's" restaurant on site which we used on both stays. Also, parking was available. Rooms, although exterior, were secure by fence around property. Very nice continental breakfast served in a breakfast room off Lobby. Coffee, tea, juices, cereals, muffins/toast/bagels and fresh fruit were supplied. Free shuttle to LAX on hour and half hour. A.C./heat unit in room dulled the noise from the airport 10 min. away so sleeping was not a problem. Requested and got same room on return from trip. This hotel is "Tops" for price and convenience to LAX and would return if a trip is warranted from L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-Century Value”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: Do not judge this Mid-Century hotel by its price. Yes, the property is a bit dated, but once inside you will be surprised to discover well landscaped interrior gardens! The room was slightly more than basic, had good TV channel selection, and free WiFi which is not overly robust and OK for checking email or reading news. There is a small single cup coffee brewer in the room and should you require decaffinated coffee filter packages, they are available atthe front desk. The only negative is finding an electrical outlet foe rechargin your devices. The bathroom has been updated as much as possible and the shower area is large and there is no tub. And to think new hotels are returning to the single shower concept and consider it a modern trend today. The front desk is small and busy with guests arriving and departing at all hours. The free LAX shuttle takes only a couple of minutes to get you to the airport. The shuttle itself offers the most leg room I have seen on any shuttle I have riden on! This service runs every half hour, 24-hours a day. The free continental breakfast is basic and the room itself is quite small, and when full simply take breakfast to your room...a la self-room serviice. This is not the Ritz, but you will save major dollars and be just as comfortable and not paying for things you will not use or need in a hotel if you are looking to crash between flights The hotel offers day rates in case you would like to rest more comfortably until your connecting flight!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night stop”
Reviews.Author: Emma071
Reviews.Content: The shuttle to and from LAX is great. Very convenient for a quick overnight stay. However it is more of a motel and quite dated. You feel as if you've walked into the past. That said it had everything we needed despite it taking 2 hours and asking 5 times to get bath towels!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Doing Business With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cook741
Reviews.Content: On July 14th I made a reservation directly with this hotel for one night for Dec. 6th at a rate of $77.22. Apx. 6 weeks later I called and cancelled my reservation and was told by the female employee when I asked that I did not need a cancellation number. I got my credit card statement last Saturday and discovered that Travelodge had charged $78.22 on my card. I was told by Customer Care Research that I would have to deal directly with the hotel. Three days later, after leaving two voice mail messages for the gen. mgr. and asst. mgr. the previous two days I called again and got the asst. mgr. Bottom line, I got an email that I didn't cancel in time, that the room was held for me, and as a courtesy they were crediting me $25! If this is the way a franchise hotel treats its customers, and corporate doesn't care, then we, the public don't need to put up with it. I would never stay at another Travelodge Hotel and I will tell all my family and friends and have them tell their friends not to also.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Layover”
Reviews.Author: Matt-Joyce
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at Travelodge on our way to Fiji and again on our way back. We arrived to LAX late, and didn't fly out until 10pm, so we extended our overnight into a dayroom. Nice room to come back to after a tour of Universal Studios, to get cleaned up before the flight. Comfortable beds, very adequate. A great value. The shuttle runs on the half hour, so there may be a wait. Walkable to the Hilton to access nice bar and restaurant. This will be our choice for day rooms and overnights when passing through LA. Rooms are nicely done, comfortable, quiet, funky retro sheek. You could almost "hear the echos" of the families who stayed in the 50s and 60s. Lots of greenery and nicely landscaped and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “funky charm”
Reviews.Author: anemonefish
Reviews.Content: We often use the TraveLodge LAX as a stop-over before early morning flights or after a long journey. It's a "mature" property, so anyone looking for a spiffy cookie-cutter hotel feel ought to look elsewhere - all the chain biggies are within walking distance (as is rent car return). This place has character. For those who enjoy live plants (poolside garden and ivy in the rooms) and a retro feel of LA like it used to be, this is a good choice. You'd not be surprised to find this hotel as the upscale choice in a small California town. Free Wi-Fi, and a conti breakfast of bagels, cereal, oatmeal, etc. (Used to have hard boiled eggs, but no more.) Housekeeping tries hard, and linens are good enough - how many hotels provide a soap dish, or a really good iron? Staff is helpful. There's a small convenience store/souvenir shop inside. Computer in the cozy lobby. A Denny's adjoins the property, and a Shell station with a larger convenience store is only yards away. Bargain online rates are common, and it's convenient to LAX. Shuttles run outbound on the half-hour; just call the hotel (phone at bag claim) to get a pickup. The area is a little noisy, so be prepared for that since many rooms have patios/balconies and large sliding glass doors. Upstairs is best, and avoid middle rooms or stairs since the hotel bustles throughout the day. Air handling by classic Friedrich heat/cool units, or windows. The TraveLodge doesn't pretend to be more than it is, and what it is serves very well.

Reviews.Title: “A motel out of the past in the present”
Reviews.Author: gus k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two days in this wonderful renovated motel built in the 1953, pink decor, set in a lush tropical setting with 80 foot tall palm trees, with clean rooms , very reasonable costs, freindly service, next to a Dennys. located next to the airport and freeways but not noisy. Howard hughes, jane russell, roy rogers, dale evans are some of yesterday stars that have atayed there. it is located 9 miles from downtown. The lodge is a true time warp example of old hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “good spot”
Reviews.Author: elle L
Reviews.Content: rooms were a bit musty and old but hey who cares price was low basic breakfast provided all you need for a airport transfer

Reviews.Title: “start and finish”
Reviews.Author: turkeyvanman
Reviews.Content: stayed here on the first and last day of our two week holiday in september. Ideal after a long flight from the uk.The hotel is a short hop in the courtesy shuttle and a easy walk to the major car hire firms, so you can have a good nights sleep then go and pick your car up without having to lug your cases with you.a decent hotel for the price with breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Fancy But Functional”
Reviews.Author: mvgregg
Reviews.Content: Traveling into the country, we had an overnight stay in LA prior to returning home to Texas. Since my wife and I had a very early flight from LAX and need a hotel with a 24-hour shuttle, we reserved a room at the Travelodge. An economy hotel chain, the typical Travelodge I've stayed in before was usually fairly modern. This wasn't the case for the LAX Travelodge: it was basically a bit run down. Although our room was large, the AC leaked quite a bit and the bathroom facilities were shabby. Since our main purpose there was to get some sleep and head back to Texas, the hotel served it's purpose, but I would likely not stay there again under similar circumstances. The pluses for the hotel were it's proximity to LAX, it's free shuttle, a Denny's restaurant next door, and a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: ilma g
Reviews.Content: I am a flight attendant with American Airlines. I stayed at the hotel the night of 12/7/2011. The bed was infested with bedbugs so intense that I needed to go to the medical clinic before my next flight for treatment on the rash covering most of my body, especially my neck. You would think management would have at least offered a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: SC1Uk
Reviews.Content: Still provides Day Rooms! Nice to find an Airport hotel that keeps to the tradition of providing a day room at a reasonable rate! After being chucked off a cruise nice and early and with a late evening flight, eventually found this hotel as one of very few which still provide day rooms. Having taken the cruise shuttle back to LAX, we were quickly picked up by the Hotel. There was a slight wait for the room, which considering we half an hour earlier than booked was not a big issue. The check in process was quick and friendly and eventually directed to the room. The room and facilities provided were excellent. The only slight issue is that we were given a room located where works were being carried out in the corridor / adjoining rooms. With the size of the property this could have probably been better planned. We were not warned of this on check in and would have preferred to be given the opportunity to wait for a quieter area of the hotel to become available. The background noise from the airport and road is understandable, as this is an airport hotel, but just remember this when booking. The staff member in the gift shop was very friendly and helpful as was the driver back to LAX in the evening. We would use this hotel again for a day room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: trekmiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice on my way into LAX and again on my way out. The room was comfortable. Rainy morning made getting to breakfast difficult since the walkways were not covered. Had a day room on my last day. Wanted to visit In & Out but shuttle did not go there so I settled for Denny's on site. All in all I was very pleased and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kara G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so convenient! The free transport to the airport was very handy. Denny's was right next door to the hotel, which was good because we didn't have to worry about finding somewhere to eat. Overall a good stay if it's just for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: foot_loose5122
Reviews.Content: We had an early flight the next day from LAX. We just needed a place to get a good night's rest and get to the airport on time. The hotel room were clean, quiet and larger than we expected. This is not a fancy hotel but all our expectations were met. They have a shuttle to the airport every half hour. They are close to all the car rental returns. The cost was reasonable and I felt there was value for this service. LA and It's traffic is not what I want to deal with during rush hour. I strongly recommend this Travelodge Hotel for insurance you get your flight and have a stress free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamainparadise808
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in September. The shuttle driver was very nice. He even took us to our car rental. The front desk staff were helpful, friendly, and efficient. The grounds were well kept. For the price, we were pleasantly surprised as to how nice the room was. It was clean and we felt comfortable being there. It had nice amenities such as hair dryer, coffee maker, free internet, free printing of boarding pass, free parking, free shuttle, free continental breakfast. Wow, what a deal! The property was simple, nice, and met our needs. Although, we were only there in the late afternoon and evening. It was not the Marriott or Fairmont, but we didn't want to pay that kind of price. Their continental breakfast looked nice, but we chose to eat at Denny's next door for breakfast and dinner because we like bigger meals with meat. Travelodge at LAX met all our needs. I would defintely stay there again and would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely better than expected”
Reviews.Author: europe_tour05
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews, I was a bit hesitant to book this hotel for our group of 5 trip. But since we were on limited budget and it was only 2 days before our trip to LA, my mum insist that we just book it, and request a ground floor room. I notified my mum and relatives to be prepared for rude staff, old rooms, etc based on what i read on the reviews. Amazingly, at time of check in and other times interacting with the staff..they showed more friendliness than many other places i've been to. The gardener was very friendly, gave us some info on halal food, and even gave my mum some gardening tips and plants to bring home. The room, though the design was 1980's but i love the separate closet area. It was a tight squeeze for 2 queen bed + 1 extra single, but we saved more dollars;) The pool area really do remind me of the american tv shows...nicely heated, but the weather was breezy and cool once me and my cousin step out of the water. Breakfast was ok for the money paid..just remember to be on time, coz they are very punctual in closing the breakfast room door. But great that they allow us to take food back to our room, so we can eat in more comfort. The location, if you have car, no problemo.. my favourite 99cents store was just down the road, a Halal Malaysia restaurant just about 10minutes away, cheap car wash nearby, and it being mid-way to Hollywood, Anaheim, San Diego, Long Beach, makes traveling easy. We stayed at Travelodge LAX for 5 nights in May 2011 and left for San Diego 2 nights, then return for another night in Travelodge LAX before leaving to Malaysia. The free hotel shuttle bus was a great plus too. A great memory to our LA stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ballardgal50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while touring colleges in the area. Good central location, and when it was time to go home, the rental car return was across the street and it's a 5 minute shuttle to LAX. Our room was really dark, but since we didn't stay in it much during the day, it really didn't matter. I thought the airport noise or street noise would bother me, but it didn't! Room was clean and there is a Denny's on site which was great for the night we got back late and didn't want to walk in the dark to find dinner. Great hotel for short stay when you want to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly place, great value”
Reviews.Author: Shanghai_Traveller1
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean rooms, and overall nice facility. This hotel was built in the 1950's but has been modernized and is a pleasant step back in time with a modern touch The positives - bigger rooms than the norm for the area. Great staff, efficient and on-time 24 hour shuttle. close to 24 hour restaurants and convenience stores, and very close to airport. The downsides, absolutely impossible to figure out the design maze and to find your room without a LOT of effort, no lift to the second floor, so be prepared to lug your bags, and a very overstressed wireless internet system. VERY slow. Overall, I liked the place. I liked the grounds. I like the staff, and would go out of my way to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average LAX hotel”
Reviews.Author: ange1971
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is extremely old. I wouldn't bother staying there again. The rooms were clean with wifi and obviously close to the airport - but that's the only advantages. There are better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “Good as it gets for the price”
Reviews.Author: w999
Reviews.Content: Free parking, free internet and free breakfast. Clean comfortable rooms, coin laundry and felt safe and well kept. They accepted a package for me and held it for me even though I picked it up the day after I checked out. You can't get much closer to LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Dated, unloved and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this hotel, we were sent to a foul smelling smoking room, in an underlit and dilapidated part of the complex, despite our booking.com reservation clearly showing we had requested a non-smoking room. After a long flight to LAX, this left a terrible first impression. It actually took a bit of arguing with staff to get moved to a non-smoking room. I was most unimpressed with their attitude, given the situation. This room was slightly better - in a section of the hotel that had been shown a little more love. It still wasn't a particularly well presented room, and not of the quality I had expected from other reviews, but sufficed given we were only going to spend one night there. I found walking around the complex slightly frightening - it is not especially well lit, and there are lots of overhangs and shadows. Despite the complexity of the site, the signs do help you clearly find your rooms - which is good as I would have hated to be lost there! Had I needed to stay in the area any longer, I would have been looking to find somewhere else. The Dennys on site looked particularly uninviting, so I wandered out onto the main road and found a Daily Grille at the nearby Westin. The up sides? Well, the shower was as good as you get in many hotels, and the shuttle bus from the airport ran frequently and was convenient. Also, it is at the lower end of the price range for the area - I guess you pay your money and take you chances!

Reviews.Title: “Close and clean”
Reviews.Author: KobieCalgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport and has a free shuttle that runs very frequently. Denny's restaurant is attached, so dining is convenient as well. Rooms are very nice and clean. The ground are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: alisdair t
Reviews.Content: Very close to all car hire depots, so when arriving from lax, only 10 minute ride to car hire depot, and a couple of minutes drive to hotel, ideal for late arrivals into los angeles. Clean, comfortable, good continental breakfast thrown in,free wifi, pool, and most of all , great price. only stopped the one night, on start of west coast tour, so ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Better Hotels to Stay at around LAX”
Reviews.Author: LaraLee55
Reviews.Content: The plus of this hotel is it is next to a Denny's and there is adequate parking for guests, family, friends that may come to see you while you are there and the parking is free. The photos are deceiving of this hotel, it doesn't look that great. If you want to check in at 10 am be prepared that the only rooms available are 2nd floor no elevator, even though I put in my notes I wanted 10 am check in and also a refrigerator the lady who checked me in said there was no notes on that? I waited 45 minutes for a room to be ready on the 1st floor, went next door to Denny's and had breakfast. When I did check in I asked about the frig and they said not in notes they would get one, I decided after looking at room not to get one after all and just use ice for my drinks. They were actually pretty quick about putting one in there as by the time I told them and went back to my room with my luggage the guy was in there putting one in, but took it out then. The frig is extra $10, microwave $10, and internet $10, unless you stay in a sleepy bear room which is two double beds. I almost wish I would have asked for a sleepy bear room as the king room was rather small and I'm use to staying in a suite, so I felt a little cramped. The room smelled strongly of bleach (had to keep the window open) and the bathroom smelled mildewy and I had to run the fan in there the whole time I was there as I'm allergic to mildew/mold. The towels are cheap and the bedspread and blanket had some holes in them. The A/C unit was not cold and kept shutting off in the middle of the night? Not sure if they have them on some type of timer or what? So I didn't sleep well as I kept getting up and trying to get the A/C to work again. The furniture was crappy and before the afternoon was done I had a sore back from sitting in the chairs. On the plus side, it was very close to airport. Scary neighborhood though and I wouldn't walk around on the streets there. Denny's had good food. Everyone was nice. The lobby was always clean, the grounds were clean, they had a lot of people working. Whatever I asked for they did promptly. When I asked for more towels they quickly gave them to me at the front desk. The breakfast was all cold stuff, bagels, pastry, cereal, they did have oatmeal packs but I didn't see them until after I had eaten, they are by the coffee machine, juice, milk. It was ok if you are ok with a cold breakfast, could have went to Denny's for a hot breakfast, but why pay for it if you don't have to.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place! Very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Tetris42
Reviews.Content: First I should give a big thank you to everyone that reviewed this hotel before I stayed here. It is because of you here at TripAdvisor that I decided to book this room. Okay, so getting into the review...it doesn't look like much from the front...kind of looks like an old motel with a Denny's in the parking lot, lol. The outside appearance suggests it has been around since the 1950's if not longer... But, once you open the door to your room, I bet you would be as surprised as I was to see how large it is! The second thing you will notice is that the decor is completely outdated. It's stuck somewhere between the 1960's and the 1980's. But, you know what? I found it to be like a time-travel experience, so I kind of enjoyed the quirkiness of the decor. Best part? CLEAN! Everything was clean! The shower, the floor throughout, the toilet (they even wrap it with a paper ribbon to show you it was cleaned before your arrival), the sheets, the furniture's surfaces. They ask you to rate your room before you leave (via comment cards in the room) and seem to genuinely care that you find it clean and comfortable. The room I stayed in had a large king-sized bed, a desk, an old tube tv (lol), and a large balcony (with walls on the sides for some privacy). Free wireless internet too! Please note that you CAN hear jet engines taking off at LAX. The hotel is very close to the runways. It didn't really bother us, but it might bother you if you are a light sleeper. Check out is noon, but you can request to stay until 2pm. We called at 11am and requested the 2pm check out and they easily obliged. Awesome. :) They have a continental breakfast but I missed it both mornings I was there, so I can't rate that for you. The lobby has a computer where you can print your flight's boarding pass free of charge. And, if you need the computer for internet or to print something other than a boarding pass, there are two available but you must pay for the service. In closing - if you don't care about the quirky/dated decor or engine noise - book it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport but just not as good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: Joanmaya
Reviews.Content: Staffs were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a good location. The room looked clean but with some weird smell.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: taffydi
Reviews.Content: I spent my first night in Califoria at this hotel before embarking on a road trip. The shuttle bus stops outside the airport at the shuttle bus stop, but you do have to phone the hotel to advise them of your arrival as the shuttle only runs on an as required basis. On arrival at the hotel I was greeted by friendly, efficient staff and given directions to my room. The room is of a good size and was clean, there is a tv in the room with a good selection of channels. There is a bit of aircraft noise I am a light sleeper and managed to sleep, mind after travelling for 18hrs I was exceptionally tired. The bathroom is a reasonable size and has a hair dryer. The shower wasn't the most powerful but was adequate. Breakfast is complimentary continental and consists of a choice of cereals, toast, juice, tea, coffee and cakes. They have a pool that looks clean and well kept but I did not get a chance to use it. Parking is free. Checkout was quick and easy. All in all I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere reasonably priced close to the airport. Would I stay there again.... Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected...”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Morelli
Reviews.Content: just stayed there for one night because was going to lax soon in the morning. Noisy room (could hear the other room's tv and talking). It seemed they were about to enter in my room. Bad pillow, dark toilet, looking dirty. Just good for location and shuttle to airport. There's a Dennys right beside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a short stay over”
Reviews.Author: Rogk79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for an overnight stay arriving or departing from the airport yes the dÃ©cor is dated but it is clean, comfy bed and a good selection of TV channels. The staff are also very friendly and the courtesy bus will collect / take you to / from the airport and will also if needed take you to your car rental firm. Also has a nice swimming pool. All in all an excellent place to stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location close to airport and car rental”
Reviews.Author: JuddyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge after a long flight from the UK prior to a road trip around the US. The hotel is close to the airport and provides good shuttle bus services to and from LAX. The room was adequate, and what I was expecting from a Travelodge although the air conditioning did not work very well. The swimming pool area was excellent with a good sized pool which was clean and well maintained. There is a "Dennys" right next door which was just what we needed. The best feature for us was that the hotel was right across the road from the Car Rental Agency which we had booked with (Thrifty) and, I believe, also close to other Car Rental. this meant that we were able to walk across the road to pick up our vehicle and drive it back to the hotel to load our luggage, rather than having to take shuttle buses as we had expected. There was also an interesting folder in the room describing the history of the hotel. Apparently it was one of the earliest airport hotels in LA, and has had many famous guests!

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: CFMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This was a great location close to Airport with shuttle bus available. Just stayed two days so was fine for my needs there was a bus stop on the corner to go to such places as Santa Monica, Venice Beach on big blue bus. Room was clean and tidy. I enjoyed my stay and staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceul (almost) place to stayover at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Rednecktraveller
Reviews.Content: It's a shame I hate and despise Los Angeles because if I ever wanted to spend more than the absolute minimum amount of time there this would be a comfortable and economical hotel to do so at. The original part of this was built in 1953--it was the first hotel in the LAX area, before LAX was LAX--and the "new" wing in 1955, so the decor is somewhat dated. However, the place has been kept up very well and is beautifully landscaped. The rooms open outward and on the inside, there are seating areas (balconies for second floor rooms) separated by dividers amongst the landscaping. The room have a semi-tropical feel and are well appointed. However, it IS close to LAX and some may be bothered by the sound of large jets (which, of course, did not exist when the hotel opened) soaring overhead. More important, the rooms whose doors face Aviation Dr are subject to a lot of traffic noise. Those drawbacks aside, you can't beat the convenience or the cost and the free airport shuttle is a great alternative to trying to drive around LAX. There is a Denny's on the property as well as the motel offing a continental breakfast that is more typical of places a notch or two higher in the lodging food chain.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: shamisimo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Travellodge LAX in august just before leaving home. The hotel is really not far from the airport and not from the rental car returns. After dropping the car we even went home by foot (we could have phoned for the shuttle service). The rooms are ok for a night, nothing special. The hotel has a very nice big pool and nice tropical gardens. shuttle service to airport is great and I think there is even a complimentary breakfast but We left before 6 am. The people at the desk were very friendly and helpful. So for the price a very good adress.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a layover at LAX”
Reviews.Author: wailoku
Reviews.Content: Finding the Travelodge for a 10 hour layover at LAX was a blessing to this weary traveller. The room was big, clean and perfect for a short rest. Although the water in the shower was not hot, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “There's something about this hotel that I love”
Reviews.Author: ElGrandT
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind this is a 2-star hotel. However, it's very clean and there is something about the architecture here that I love. I'm used to stay in much fancier hotels, but when in LA I always try to sleep here. However, don't count on their shuttle service. Rent a car (you'll probably would anyway, this is LA).

Reviews.Title: “Great to use as day room”
Reviews.Author: Ozejim
Reviews.Content: We got a day room prior to flying out of LAX. Very good for the price $49. 95 (plus tax of course). Great value if you want a shower, quick meal at Dennys even a swim in the pool. Hotel shuttle leaves every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel to use after a long flight. Attached Denny's is a bonus”
Reviews.Author: Nick W
Reviews.Content: Great motel to use for our 1st night's stay in LA after a long flight from the UK. Ample parking, swift check in & a comfortable room. Hotel has a good size pool (although we didn't use it), & the Denny's restaurant on site made for a welcome evening meal & breakfast. The hotel is only 5 minutes or so from all the major car rental depots, & even though it was close to LAX, plane noise was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great transit hotel near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Yordan_Wattimena
Reviews.Content: Clean room near airport with 24 hour shuttle to airport Free breakfast using budget hotel standard (don't expect 5 star hotel breakfast) I don't hear any airplane noise at night or I'm so tired after long flight to US :) The only downside is public transportation for those stay more than 1 day (mine only 1 day transit) as there is not much option, the only good option is take bus to aviation/lax metro station from intersection where metro will take you to other part of LA

Reviews.Title: “"It's like going back to 1960 again - in a good way"”
Reviews.Author: GregorySeven
Reviews.Content: The place should be a motel museum - that sort of comfy, family in the station wagon, charming motel from the glorious 60's. But don't misunderstand me...it's a good place to stay and fairly modern. The location is really only 5 minutes from LAX, there's a Denny's attached, the rooms are basic but clean and quiet, the staff was actually competent and helpful! There's a Taco Bell only a 7 minute walk away. I miss it since I live in Asia. Since the motel is soo large and meandering...ask for a room near the lobby. The breakfast room is really small and crowded, so don't expect to be able to eat there - take the food back to your room. Amazing value for money so near to LAX.....and the pool was cute and full of happy kid's who reminded me of my Travelodge pool-swimming trips.... years ago. If you're rich - stay at the Beverly Hills Hotel, if you're not - stay here! Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the average chain motel, & brilliant for the airport”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Abbott
Reviews.Content: Although probably the oldest motel for miles, and thus not in brand spanking new condition, we found that it was actually much less tired and shabby than other motels we stayed in on our trip (from a variety of chains). The room was larger and consequently more comfortable than others we'd experienced, as well as being in better condition. Being upstairs, we had a nice balcony - ground floor rooms each had a little terrace that would have been less private. The rooms surround a pool that is actually big enough to use (many motel pools are little bigger than bathtubs), and there is a gift shop selling drinks and confectionery - as well as tourist tat - until 10pm. A basic breakfast is included (6am to 9am only), but in a very confined area. However, a "Denny's" restaurant is also on site if you like expensive greasy stuff (and this one has a bar, which is good), and fast-food outlets are within walking distance. The key to this place however is convenience; it's only about a mile and a half from LAX airport, and provides a shuttle bus; it's also very close to the rental car drop-off points, which also provide their own shuttles. This convenience comes at a price however (no, not a financial one - it's surprisingly cheap, especially if booked in advance) - the proximity to the airport means considerable 'plane noise, and century boulevard outside generates a lot of traffic noise. However, it's location, location, location, and absolutely perfect for the airport in either direction. Also handy for other sout/west LA locations such as Long Beach, Redondo Beach, Venice Beach (mad and tacky, but good fune, and only about 5 miles), Santa Monica etc.

Reviews.Title: “we would certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LynnPearce
Reviews.Content: We ( two couples) arrived at LAX quite early in the morning ( after a flight from Australia), and didn't have to wait too long for the shuttle to arrive (we called them to let them know we needed picking up). We had reserved two rooms, for a one nights stay, but had not asked for early check in. Even though it was before 11am there was one room ready for us to use and were promised the other within the hour - which was delivered. They didn't charge us any extra for the early check in and the staff were pleasant and extremely accommodating overall. The rooms were air-conditioned, very clean and reasonably spacious and the bed was quite comfortable. The shower/ toilet area was showing its age a little but was clean and had everything we needed and there was a nice little area to make coffee etc. The free breakfast was simple but quite enough - a couple of different kinds of cereals, bagels, bread, jams and fruits, tea coffee juice etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: friendoforca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 5 minute ride from LAX. Very convenient location. Entrance to the 405 is a block or two away. Very comfortable, clean, and a very good value. Pool nice. Breakfast included, just what we needed to start off our day. Directly across the street from rental car places if you need a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “That's someplace like home!”
Reviews.Author: YukihoK
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during our New Year's holiday, and we were not disappointed. The people at the hotel were nice, helpful and attentive. Despite its location near the airport, the room we lived in was quiet and pleasant. Our room was simple, comfy and made us feel very at ease. Breakfast was continental. It offered toasts, bagels( I loved the cinnamon type) and pastries. Hot beverage, cereal, fruits were also provided. For people who are looking for a meal to cure hangover, homesickness or lack of sleep due to time difference, it is certainly a decent option. Breakfast ended early, though, which was a little inconvenient for us, since we really would like to sleep in. Overall, it was a hotel with a home-like experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IndianTraveller5980
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Travelodge, LAX for one night after taking a flight from Washington, D.C, on my way back to India. The room was nice and spacious, but nowhere near luxurious. I guess luxury isnt even a criteria in this case. For a nice short business stay this wouldnt be a bad option, but I wouldnt come here on a holiday with my wife. They provided transportation to LAX which is real convinient.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great deal for the money and clean”
Reviews.Author: MatLet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel only one night, because we needed to be close to our rental car pickup the following day. Fox Rental Car is right across the street. They have the best rates in LA for a car. It ended up being a very nice place. Very kitchie with catus outside of each room. It was a VERY busy hotel. it was clean, older, but well kept up. You will have to walk up stairs to the rooms. No elevators. We happened to placed in the far back area of the hotel. It took a bit to figure out where our room was and to haul our 4 pieces of luggage up the stairs. I felt it was a great deal for the money and if I was just touring LA I would consider staying there. I think it is a popular stopping off point for most travelers. The breakfast was simply bagels and danishes. Which was fine with us, but if you were staying there longer you might want to visit the Denny's which is right next door. I thought it was a great value for the money. The staff were also very polite and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: 9g1a6j
Reviews.Content: Parking is HORRENDOUS. Cars were double and even triple parked, some in the fire lane. This hotel has one of the worst parking layouts I have ever seen. Big empty lot next door â€“ why the owners couldn't buy it and turn it into a â€œrealâ€� parking lot is beyond me. I went to leave and found I was blocked in by a big SUV parked in the fire lane behind me. It took me a good 45 minutes, with the help of a passerby, to back my car out of the spot. Front entrance is not well marked so when I first drove by on Aviation Rd, I missed the turn (hint: turn into the lot right after the Shell sign). I turned right after the hotel and wound up in the back parking area (actually an alley). All the gates were locked and the signs said â€œGo to South entranceâ€�. But who knows which way is south in an unfamiliar city? Better to have written â€œGo left/right for lobbyâ€� Room wasn't ready for about 45 minutes so we went to Denny's for breakfast. Typical Denny's â€“ overcrowded, slow staff, weak coffee. Room was OK for $90. 2 double beds â€“ really comfy, good pillows. Small TV but it had some good cable channels. Big window AC unit was very loud whenever it was on. Other than the noise of the AC, I didn't hear any plane or street noises. Bathroom overhead light was really really dim. Then son discovered the switch for the mirror light â€“ right in the bottom middle of the mirror â€“ where the hairdryer and coffeemaker were plugged in. Not marked at all and very easy to miss at first glance. Wallpaper was peeling by the shower stall â€“ probably due to water splashing out of the shower. Grounds and pool were very nice. A very nice tropical feel. All the plants had little name labels, which was a nice touch. Patio was also nice â€“ 2 chairs and a little table. Computers in the lobby are no longer free. $0.33/min for computer, $0.50/page for printing. I didn't use the free wifi in the room since I had my Clear modem. I got a great signal so there must be towers nearby. I didn't use the shuttle since I rented a car from across the street. Nor did I use the breakfast since we had a 6:30am flight. I didn't feel the room was worth $90/night, but it was a holiday weekend and it is very close to LAX. It's good for a 1 night layover/stay, but the parking situation is just too much for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Day rooms are a great value, and highly recommended for those long layovers...”
Reviews.Author: ROBINBEALdotCOM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner on the way back from Australia when our flight from Sydney arrived around 7:00am and our connecting flight home to Orlando didn't leave until almost 11:00pm. Their day room rate was $49 plus tax and the free shuttle made it an amazing value. They picked us up at Tom Bradley a few minuted after we phoned the desk. The van was clearly marked as Travelodge LAX -- worth mentioning as some hotels near the airport use a shuttle service that goes to many hotels, and the only identifiers for the hotels they serve are the electronic lighted signs that scroll names across (not exactly the most fun thing to try and decipher when you've just come off a 15 hour flight). Although far from modern, the room was very clean and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Much to my surprise, the mattress set appeared to be brand new -- I pulled back the sheets and had a look before crashing out completely. Slept like a baby. FREE WIFI! Yes, that does exist at some hotels still and this is one of them. Worked great on our iPhones and was fast enough for a Skype call to New Zealand as I needed to cancel a reservation because we had to come home early due to a volcanic ash cloud. Just be sure and remember to ask for the code when you get your room key. The desk clerk will write it down for you. The bathrooms are slightly dark here and the shower was very dark, but the high-pressure head and hot water made up for it. It was perfect for freshening up in-transit, and they supply soaps and shampoo just like you would expect so if your bags are checked through you needn't worry about buying toiletries beyond what you're probably carrying in your favorite TSA-approved freezer bag. The staff was helpful and friendly, and professional! There is a Denny's located practically on-site as well as a petrol station. We ate at the Denny's before heading back to the airport to make the connecting flight -- very good value here as well. The bottom line is this: it's nothing fancy, it's not new and modern, but if you don't mind a blast from the past straight back to 1980 and you need a comfortable bed and a hot shower in-between flights, you absolutely can't do better than Travelodge LAX. Great value. I will be booking here again the next time I'm traveling to far-flung places via LAX.

Reviews.Title: “fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: ejdejd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight for an early flight. We were a bit worried about traffic noise when we arrived but didn't hear much in the room at all. Yes you will hear planes - you are next to a large airport!. Room was clean and quite spacious and nice pool for a quick dip to end the day. Very handy having the Denny's on the premises as not much to wander around to. Free shuttle prompt and worked well. Would recommend this hotel for those looking for a night close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep guranteed!”
Reviews.Author: businessmom1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before an early flight to LAX. If you are looking for a quiet night's sleep, this is not the place. The A/C didn't work, and throughout the night trucks, planes, suitcases, etc passed my room making the hard bed and pillows practically unbearable. I got up before my 4:30 am wake-up call! The room was clean (if a bit shabby), and the landscaping was quite nice. I had booked this hotel on the nice pictures and the price, but it was not worth losing a night of sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: beakyfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 nite 1 nite and returning for 2 nites in July Room was clean and airport shuttle was very quick, bus close by to take you to santa monica Shuttle also dropped us off at hertz next day

Reviews.Title: “best lax choice for us”
Reviews.Author: GACuster
Reviews.Content: This motel exceeded our expectations. It was converted from an older Hyatt and retained some of the ambiance. The desk people and especially the security guard were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, good-sized and had a small private patio. We were poolside so I can't speak for the outside rooms, but ours was very quiet especially since we were so near LAX. Having a Denny's right next door, a gas station and three car rental agencies within a block made it ideal for our needs. The landscaping in the campus was very enjoyable. The breakfast was not sumptuous but adequate and the shuttle very efficient. The only down-side was that the room was more expensive than advertised on the Wyndham web site. The desk people said it was because of a tourist tax that had not been included.

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive alternative for conferences.”
Reviews.Author: leslieinsf
Reviews.Content: I have attended conferences at both the nearby Hilton and the Westin up the street, and paid conference room rates of twice what the Travelodge charges, plus 13 bucks a day for internet and exorbitant restaurant and room rates. Last time, I decided to try something way cheaper, since I'm hardly in my room anyway, and I"m glad I did. This is a classic old two-story motel with a swimming pool in the middle. Our room was in a way- back wing. It was perfectly adequate. The beds were comfortable, linens were clean, everything worked fine. The staff at the front were helpful and polite. The breakfast bar is really just bagels and toast and juice, but it's free and fast if that will hold you. If not, there's a Denny's right there and you can get whatever you want 24 hours. There's also a Carl's Jr on the way to the Hilton and other fast food in the other direction if that's more your style. I'll definitely stay there again, but will ask for a 2nd floor room facing the pool. You just cannot beat the price -- it cost me less than half of what I would have paid at the big hotel, and I got a little exercise waking to and from the meetings every day, too. Free shuttle to and from the airport -- call when you're there so they know you're waiting. If you're the kind of person who likes five star hotels at five star prices, you'll hate it here. But if you like old-school simplicity, this is great.

Reviews.Title: “Most logical, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: HunterMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Needed to make a day and 1/2 layover. The Free shuttle was prompt. Front desk had my reservation and processed quickly. We paid to extend until 6:00pm. Front desk was helpful to suggest bus routes to shopping mall. Breakfast was great and well kept breakfast area. Much less expensive than some in the area. Room was large and had well furnished. Lots of plants in the gardens and even a fresh plant in the room. Where else have you stayed and saw that?

Reviews.Title: “Damp, smelly and yes - Grotty”
Reviews.Author: polymol
Reviews.Content: The defensive managment need to understand that the younger generation can and do appreciate older hotels and also to admit that this hotel has a damp problem that needs resolving before any painting/updating of rooms takes place. All we wanted was a cheap clean room to sleep in after our long flight. The room was as clean as it could be, but the damp problem meant that no amount of cleaning would make the room acceptable. I could not get away from the worry about what was going on under the lumpy carpet. I am more than happy to appreciate older hotels - just not damp old hotels. Good points - Shower was nice and powerful, planting around the grounds made the place look better, close to the airport but not too much aiport noise, we found the reception staff helpfull and there is free parking. The defensive managment however need to go on a Mary Gober customer service course and realise that if they want good reviews they have to provide a good service - and listen. Sorry but this place is very poor and all becasue of the damp. Could not wait to get out before my luggage started to smell. Find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay close to LAX for layover”
Reviews.Author: BurtLou
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet, clean and friendly place to stay when on a layover. Shuttle to LAX every hour on the hour. (free). Complimentary plain breakfast is available. I have stayed here twice and will do it again if the need arises. An adjacent Denny's provides Denny's type food and a nice lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: pualani4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the night before our flight back to Hawaii. The manager checked us in and was very nice and gave us adjoining rooms (traveled with our son and his family). Didn't get to see much as we arrived in the afternoon. There is a Dennys on the property which made it very convenient for us to relax before our flight home. Parking is limited, luckily we had a spot when someone pulled out. Rooms were small but adequate. Smelled musty but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSTravelboss
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th stay at Travelodge LAX as I use it for overnights when traveling overseas, but the 1st time in front area upstairs room 201. Room was basic, with 2 beds, coffee machine and cable TV. Drawbacks were 3 things, first it was so dark in bathroom we could not see in shower and no exhaust fan working, second the room heater was so noisy we turned it off after 20 minutes, third there is a gap at bottom of door to outside hall that the wind was coming through. We still like the free breakfast and pickup at airport and staff is very friendly. If we use again for overnight will insist on rooms in back of hotel which while in darker area of hotel are still better then one on this trip. Fanily likes that there is a Denny's next door to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: rortoni
Reviews.Content: Not the best neighborhood in L.A, but a nice place to crash between flights. Rooms are dated but spacious, nice garden area. Staff is average. Liked the "Ramiro" cat at front desk! 24h Dennys restaurant is really helpful after a long flight. Free parking is a plus. Very nice value for a LAX hotel. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LubbockTexas
Reviews.Content: Checked in before a early morning flight rooms were very clean beds were comfy bathroom was clean airport shuttle took me right to the place I wanted to go I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FELT LIKE THE BRONKS”
Reviews.Author: JulieRichardT
Reviews.Content: We checked in here to have a rest and shower before a midnight flight, I did not feel safe here at all. While putting luggage in the car at night you are watching over your shoulder the whole time as it did not feel safe out the bAck where our room was located, Staff are not very friendly or helpful, our first and last stay here. The rooms are old and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Layover retreat”
Reviews.Author: NovotelQT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel having arrived off an international flight and we were looking for reasonably cheap option near the airport. We had read the Tripadvisor and other reviews and were under no illusions that the Hotel would be a budget Hotel. Arriving early at the Hotel we were concerned we may not be able to get into our room until later in the day. We were welcomed by the staff and did get into the room early - the Hotel looked ok and there were not the concerns of other reviewers - the area looked like any large city airport location. The room was ok - a bit old and run down but relatively clean and tidy - certainly nothing flash but again what had been paid for. The pool looked ok - breakfast was a bit sparse and in a cramped space but looked ok although we did not have it even though it was included. From the Hotel it was easy to catch a bus to Santa Monica and ok to get a train to central city although with children I would not come home late by train - was starting to get a bit strange even at around 9pm. Negatives: Did get a few bites on the second night but that could have been mosquitoes?? Did not book the shuttle in the morning as was told it would be no problem but it was full so we took a cab - only a few minutes away. Was noisy (expected this with the airport) but both nights other guests and staff(??) made a lot of noise - would not have liked to have been in the rooms by the road as that would have been too much

Reviews.Title: “Awful front desk lady, rude and not helpful”
Reviews.Author: shrimpchips828
Reviews.Content: I booked a night for my dad who does not speak English and just arrived in the US. When I called to request a shuttle to the LAX airport, I tried to give the front desk lady more information in order to make sure my dad did not miss it. To my surprise, the front desk lady refused to take it and my dad missed it! The second time I called, she stressed that it was my dad's fault that he missed the shuttle because he was not standing at the correct place. However, the truth was, he was always standing at the red sign. Then she told me that there was another phone call coming in and wanted to put me on hold. Surely I didn't agree, and she hung me up! When I asked her how to complain her to a manager, she told me that she was the front desk manager. I assume that was to say there was no way to complain. I couldn't believe it just happened! The worst customer services in the world! I will never ever stay there again and do not suggest anyone stay there.

Reviews.Title: “grotty”
Reviews.Author: aussie_travel_mum_
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in transit between LA and New York. The hotel was very tired and the room had an unpleasant odour. However, for the cheap price we paid we couldn't expect much more! The onsite restaurant is Dennys which provides a very cheap but not so nice meal. To it's advantage, our hire car depot was directly across the road which proved convenient. The complimentary hotel aiport shuttle departs every half hour and conveniently took us to the airport at 6am. We will not stay here on our next layover.

Reviews.Title: “I like this Hotel: Clean, cozy and well located”
Reviews.Author: juliancho79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the price. I liked it a lot. Rooms are fine and very clean. Not fancy but very well located and with bus service to LAX airport. Comfortable. Again: Very good for the price. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nursing home rooms”
Reviews.Author: chilopoda2
Reviews.Content: I was toying with the idea of giving this property a below average rating, but it just made it into the average category. The price is reasonable and the location is convenient to LAX, but next time I will definitely spend the extra 30$ and stay at the Westin (down the street). This place is dark and depressing and (as others have noted) feels a little bit creepy. Apparently, the neighborhood is safe, but the presence of many security fences and dark alleys speaks volumes. The room was clean, but smelled and looked like it was straight out of a nursing home or hospital. The shower did not work well and dripped all night. Also, do not get too excited over the complimentary breakfast which was not at all memorable. I felt very happy to leave this place and get on my flight home to my own bed!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but all comforts”
Reviews.Author: Dawncg
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel directly from the glitz of las Vegas, and initially was disapionted by the tired looking rooms. Then the reception staff proved to be more than helpful, I discovered the generous tea & coffee facilities (not provided in Vegas) . The patio door lead to a small but relaxing pool, and the wifi was free ($14.00 per day in Vegas) so now my opinion was picking up at speed!! Breakfast was included in the (very low) room rate and I must say it was a decent breakfast too, with coffee, herbal teas, fresh fruit and cereals and assorted pastries. We checked out at 10.00am but were not flying until 10 pm, but the staff looked after our luggage and kindly allowed us to wait in the reception area for an hour before our departure. What great value this was for such a low rate, (the courtesy airport shuttle is included) and although the room decor wont ever win any awards, the comfort, amenities and friendliness of staff made this a great little place to spend the last night before our flight home.

Reviews.Title: “Best value close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: cynlew
Reviews.Content: Value was great for a good nights sleep and a short distance from LAX. By no means is it a 3, 4 , or 5 star hotel. I thought I had travelled back in time to 1970, as it was very outdated! However, the room was clean, the staff was friendly, and and the beds were comfortable.Just what we needed after a long flight from China. Having the Denny's next door was a plus when we'd had nothing but Chinese food for 2 weeks!! All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel and value. Close to airport, beaches.”
Reviews.Author: Soulsurfer3
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a great hotel and value, there's not much of interest nearby besides the airport; but it's 10 minutes from Manhattan and other beaches. There's a clean pool and each room has either a balcony or deck to the courtyard. The rooms are clean and relatively spacious. TV's are on the small side, but they have wireless internet. Overall, not a luxurious hotel, but it's only $70/night. For that it's an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence20
Reviews.Content: After waiting almost two hours for the shuttle, we decided to give up and we played 30$ for two taxis. When we arrived, the staff at reception couldn't care less, we checked in and was taken to our room, we had to look at 4 rooms until we found one that didn't stink. The room was awful, the bed had mold growing on the bottom and the sheets were very dusty. The toilet was small and smelly and hadn't been flushed by the cleaner before we arrived. We were woken up at 2 in the morning as a women was arguing outside our door with one of the staff, she claimed to have booked a smoking room and she wanted to smoke in her room, the staff member simply said it "didn't matter, the non smoking rooms are just there so the hotel could look appealing to families travelling through LAX". Yes, we could hear the whole conversation from our room. The next morning we told reception about the filthy room and then went to the breakfast, it was limited and rubbish. To be honest, I do not have much to say about this hotel... other than it's rubbish Do not make the mistake of going to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “spot on”
Reviews.Author: James-Turnbull
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel at the start and end of our road trip from L.A to vegas to san francisco, check in went quickly enough although they could have been quicker when i went back round because our room keys didnt work. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfy, breakfast was fine if your after something quick although we had breakfast in dennys which was pretty good. We drove into downtown L.A on the first day, half an hour took us in, traffic wasn't too bad, recommend the city sightseeing tour we got it for 20 dollars each and it lets you c pretty much all there is to see in about 1 and a half/ 2hours. We drove to six flags the second day bout 45 mins away it was a good day out also. overall this hotel is perfect if your looking for a place to get your head down, seen a few complaints about aircraft noise, me personally, didnt hear a thing!

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Chris7542
Reviews.Content: our room was damp, but clean breakfast was good enough very close to the rentalcars, so perfect for a first night stay Dennys on the corner is 24 hr open

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dublin3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really great value when all you are looking for is a place to sleep. I read many of the reviews for the hotel, and while most were positive some were not very encouraging. Sure, the place is not as snazzy as the bigger, newer hotels at LAX, but it is clean, the wifi and parking are free, and the staff are pleasent. Plus, the Denny's next door is perfect! In response to other reviewers that complained about aircraft noise; it is an airport hotel so planes will be landing until after midnight and you will hear them no matter which hotel you stay in. But really, the noise is not that bad, and if you are tired you won't even notice them.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: 3boysMomandDad
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night prior to leaving CA. The room was large with a full bathroom . Was not as noisy as expected. The hotel had a nice breakfast. Did not get to use the pool, but it seemed nice. Parking was an issue as there are several parking areas that you could use. The staff was helpful Great price!

Reviews.Title: “just right for the price”
Reviews.Author: SL27
